entry.message: [info] Activation of plug-in DQC Rules Validator successful, version Check version using Tools->DQC->Version on the GUI or --dqc-version on the command line. - validate/DQC
[info] Activation of plug-in SEC Inline Transforms successful, version 19.2. - transforms/SEC

[DQC.US.0043.7488] The concept GainLossOnDerivativeInstrumentsNetPretax is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. This is in the role 036 - Disclosure - Note 12 - Restatement of Financial Statements - Restatement of Financial Statements (Details). GainLossOnDerivativeInstrumentsNetPretax is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. GainLossOnDerivativeInstrumentsNetPretax has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and GainLossOnDerivativeInstrumentsNetPretax is the correct concept, input a negative value. In this case the company has reported the child concept GainLossOnDerivativeInstrumentsNetPretax multiple times with alternative weights.
Rule Element Id:7488 Rule version: 17.0.0 - https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1295961/000143774922001542/qegy20210831b_10qa.htm 1413

[DQC.US.0043.7488] The concept GainLossOnDebtConversion is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. This is in the role 036 - Disclosure - Note 12 - Restatement of Financial Statements - Restatement of Financial Statements (Details). GainLossOnDebtConversion is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. GainLossOnDebtConversion has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and GainLossOnDebtConversion is the correct concept, input a negative value. In this case the company has reported the child concept GainLossOnDebtConversion multiple times with alternative weights.
Rule Element Id:7488 Rule version: 17.0.0 - https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1295961/000143774922001542/qegy20210831b_10qa.htm 1413

[DQC.US.0043.7488] The concept CommonStockPayableUnrealizedLoss is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. This is in the role 036 - Disclosure - Note 12 - Restatement of Financial Statements - Restatement of Financial Statements (Details). CommonStockPayableUnrealizedLoss is a debit balance type concept representing a natural cash inflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. A debit balance type concept should always be assigned a positive one (+1) calculation weight as it is an addition to net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. CommonStockPayableUnrealizedLoss has been incorrectly provided a negative one (-1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to positive one (+1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is an addition of a non-cash expense or loss, a decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability. If the value is an increase in an asset or a decrease in a liability and CommonStockPayableUnrealizedLoss is the correct concept, input a negative value. In this case the company has reported the child concept CommonStockPayableUnrealizedLoss multiple times with alternative weights.
Rule Element Id:7488 Rule version: 17.0.0 - https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1295961/000143774922001542/qegy20210831b_10qa.htm 1413
